case.name: In the matter of Ansett Australia Limited (ACN 004 209410) [2006] FCA 277 (22 March 2006)

application by liquidators for order that assets of companies "be pooled" and all creditors be paid from pool without regard to which of companies was indebted
no attempt to invoke provisions under which majority can bind minority
winding up as sequel to voluntary administration
two companies with common characteristics carrying on business in succession
whether assets and liabilities may be pooled in what is effectively single winding up

power to amend trading trust instrument

whether amendment after approval of beneficiaries would constitute a fraud on the power of amendment; corporations
scope of gambotto principles; practice and procedure

when power to allot exceeded. equity

supreme court (general civil procedure) rules 2005 r 54.02.

citances.sentence:
Their Honours were referring to the legislation in New South Wales, which is somewhat wider than the Victorian. This does not affect the applicability in Victoria of their Honours' general observations. Riddle v Riddle has been followed in the Federal Court of Australia, [67] Victoria [68] and the other States [69] and I will apply it in the present case.
Expedient in the interests of who or what? 155 Section 63(1) specifies expedience to be the criterion for determining whether a power should be conferred on the trustees for the management or administration of trust property.

[8] [1952] HCA 12 ; (1952) 85 CLR 202 at 214. [9] Ibid. See also In the matter of Ansett Australia Limited (ACN 004 209 410) [2006] FCA 277 at [83] - [84]. [10] [1952] HCA 12 ; (1952) 85 CLR 202 at 216. [11] [1968] VicRp 16 ; [1968] VR 168 , supra.
